page.title: 08RAIL TRANSPORT
page.content: A single track railway line runs through the area along the east bank of the River Conwy. The line is open to passengers and freight and connects Llandudno Junction with Blaenau Ffestiniog, whilst a freight only spur leads on to serve Trawsfynydd nuclear power station. At Blaenau the line connects with the privately owned Ffestiniog narrow guage railway thus completing an interesting west-north coast link through spectacular scenary. The line is served by nine passenger trains a day in summer and five in winter running in both directions. Connections with the main BR network are made at Llandudno Junction. The nearest station is Tal-y-cafn just to the south of the Henryd area.
